title: Construction industry
summary: Construction of new buildings and repairs or alterations to existing properties in Great Britain measured by the amount charged for the work, including work by civil engineering companies.
metaDescription: Construction of new buildings and repairs or alterations to existing properties in Great Britain measured by the amount charged for the work, including work by civil engineering companies.

title: International trade
summary: Trade in goods and services across the UK's international borders, including total imports and exports, the types of goods and services traded and general trends in international trade.
metaDescription: Trade in goods and services across the UK's international borders, including total imports and exports, the types of goods and services traded and general trends in international trade.

title: IT and internet industry
summary: Internet sales by businesses in the UK (total value and as a percentage of all retail sales) and the percentage of businesses that have a website and broadband connection. These figures indicate the importance of the internet to UK businesses.
metaDescription: Internet sales by businesses in the UK (total value and as a percentage of all retail sales) and the percentage of businesses that have a website and broadband connection. These figures indicate the importance of the internet to UK businesses.

title: Manufacturing and production industry
summary: UK manufacturing and other production industries (such as mining and quarrying, energy supply, water supply and waste management), including total UK production output, and UK manufactures' sales by product and industrial division, with EU comparisons.
metaDescription: UK manufacturing and other production industries (such as mining and quarrying, energy supply, water supply and waste management), including total UK production output, and UK manufactures' sales by product and industrial division, with EU comparisons.

title: Retail industry
summary: Sales by retailers in Great Britain directly to end consumers, including spending on goods (in store and online) (Retail Sales Index) and spending on services (Index of Services). The industry as a whole is used as an indicator of how the wider economy is performing and the strength of consumer spending.

title: Tourism industry
summary: Tourism and travel (including accommodation services, food and beverage services, passenger transport services, vehicle hire, travel agencies and sports, recreational and conference services), employment levels and output of the tourism industry, the number of visitors to the UK and the amount they spend.
metaDescription: Tourism and travel (including accommodation services, food and beverage services, passenger transport services, vehicle hire, travel agencies and sports, recreational and conference services), employment levels and output of the tourism industry, the number of visitors to the UK and the amount they spend.

title: Environmental accounts
summary: Environmental accounts show how the environment contributes to the economy (for example, through the extraction of raw materials), the impacts that the economy has on the environment (for example, energy consumption and air emissions), and how society responds to environmental issues (for example, through taxation and expenditure on environmental protection). This site also hosts the development of natural capital accounts, more information is available in the Methodology section.
metaDescription: Environmental accounts show how the environment contributes to the economy (for example, through the extraction of raw materials), the impacts that the economy has on the environment (for example, energy consumption and air emissions), and how society responds to environmental issues (for example, through taxation and expenditure on environmental protection).

title: Gross Domestic Product (GDP)
summary: Preliminary, second and final estimates of GDP released over a quarter as more data becomes available. The final estimate is published in the Quarterly National Accounts. GDP is the main measure of UK economic growth based on the value of goods and services produced during a given period.
metaDescription: Preliminary, second and final estimates of GDP released over a quarter as more data becomes available. The final estimate is published in the Quarterly National Accounts. GDP is the main measure of UK economic growth based on the value of goods and services produced during a given period.

title: Gross Value Added (GVA)
summary: Regional gross value added using production (GVA(P)) and income (GVA(I)) approaches. Regional gross value added is the value generated by any unit engaged in the production of goods and services. GVA per head is a useful way of comparing regions of different sizes. It is not, however, a measure of regional productivity.
metaDescription: Regional gross value added using production (GVA(P)) and income (GVA(I)) approaches. Regional gross value added is the value generated by any unit engaged in the production of goods and services. GVA per head is a useful way of comparing regions of different sizes. It is not, however, a measure of regional productivity.

title: Inflation and price indices
summary: The rate of increase in prices for goods and services. Measures of inflation and prices include consumer price inflation, producer price inflation, the house price index, index of private housing rental prices, and construction output price indices.
keywords: Consumer Price Index,Retail Price Index,Producer Price Index,Services Producer Price Indices,Index of Private Housing Rental Prices,CPIH,RPIJ
metaDescription: The rate of increase in prices for goods and services. Measures of inflation and prices include consumer price inflation, producer price inflation, the house price index, index of private housing rental prices, and construction output price indices.

title: Investments, pensions and trusts
summary: Net flows of investment into the UK, the number of people who hold pensions of different types, and investments made by various types of trusts.
metaDescription: Net flows of investment into the UK, the number of people who hold pensions of different types, and investments made by various types of trusts.

title: Crime and justice
summary: Figures on crime levels and trends for England and Wales based primarily on two sets of statistics: the Crime Survey for England and Wales (CSEW) and police recorded crime data.
metaDescription: Crimes committed and the victims' characteristics, sourced from crimes recorded by the police and from the Crime Survey for England and Wales (CSEW). The outcomes of crime in terms of what happened to the offender are also included.

title: Education and childcare
summary: Early years childcare, school and college education, and higher education and adult learning, including qualifications, personnel, and safety and well-being.
metaDescription: Early years childcare, school and college education, and higher education and adult learning, including qualifications, personnel, and safety and well-being.

title: Housing
summary: Property price, private rent and household survey and census statistics, used by government and other organisations for the creation and fulfilment of housing policy in the UK.
metaDescription: Property price, private rent and household survey and census statistics, used by government and other organisations for the creation and fulfilment of housing policy in the UK.

title: Leisure and tourism
summary: Visits and visitors to the UK, the reasons for visiting and the amount of money they spent here. Also UK residents travelling abroad, their reasons for travel and the amount of money they spent. The statistics on UK residents travelling abroad are an informal indicator of living standards.
metaDescription: Visits and visitors to the UK, the reasons for visiting and the amount of money they spent here. Also UK residents travelling abroad, their reasons for travel and the amount of money they spent. The statistics on UK residents travelling abroad are an informal indicator of living standards.

title: Well-being
summary: Societal and personal well-being in the UK looking beyond what we produce, to areas such as health, relationships, education and skills, what we do, where we live, our finances and the environment. This data comes from a variety of sources and much of the analysis is new.
metaDescription: Societal and personal well-being in the UK looking beyond what we produce, to areas such as health, relationships, education and skills, what we do, where we live, our finances and the environment. This data comes from a variety of sources and much of the analysis is new.

title: Activity, size and location
summary: UK businesses broken down by location, industry, legal status and employment, and UK enterprise levels measured by turnover.
metaDescription: UK businesses broken down by location, industry, legal status and employment, and UK enterprise levels measured by turnover.

title: Business innovation
summary: Research and development in the UK carried out or funded by business enterprises, higher education, government (including research councils) and private non-profit organisations.
metaDescription: Research and development in the UK carried out or funded by business enterprises, higher education, government (including research councils) and private non-profit organisations.

title: Business services
summary: Size and growth of the UK non-financial business economy as measured by the Annual Business Survey (ABS), and the value of e-commerce and the adoption and use of information and communication technologies (ICTs) by UK businesses.

title: Bankruptcy/insolvency
summary: UK business insolvencies, bankruptcies and other forms of debt relief.

title: Business births, deaths and survival rates
summary: Demography of UK businesses: active businesses, new registrations for VAT and PAYE (births), cessation of trading (deaths), and duration of trading (survival rates).
metaDescription: Demography of UK businesses: active businesses, new registrations for VAT and PAYE (births), cessation of trading (deaths), and duration of trading (survival rates).

title: Mergers and acquisitions
summary: Business mergers and acquisitions involving UK companies, including de-mergers and disposals, where the transaction value is £1 million or more.
metaDescription: Business mergers and acquisitions involving UK companies, including de-mergers and disposals, where the transaction value is £1 million or more.

title: Output
summary: Economic output, including manufacturing and production (Index of Production) and services (Index of Services).
metaDescription: Economic output, including manufacturing and production (Index of Production) and services (Index of Services).

title: Productivity measures
summary: Economic productivity measures, including output per hour, output per job and output per worker for the whole economy and a range of industries; productivity in the public sector; and international comparisons of productivity across the G7 nations.
metaDescription: Economic productivity measures, including output per hour, output per job and output per worker for the whole economy and a range of industries; productivity in the public sector; and international comparisons of productivity across the G7 nations.

title: Public services productivity
summary: Output, inputs and productivity estimates for public services in the UK, including estimates of healthcare and education productivity.

title: Local government finance
summary: Spending on science, engineering and technology by central government departments, research councils and higher education funding councils (HEFCs).
metaDescription: This is what local government is given from the overall budget, and what they spend it on.

title: Public sector finance
summary: How the relationship between UK public sector monthly income and expenditure leads to changes in deficit and debt.
metaDescription: UK public sector spending, tax revenues and investments, including government debt and deficit (the gap between revenue and spending) and data submitted to the European Commission.

title: Public spending
summary: UK government debt and deficit as reported to the European Commission each January, April, July and October.
metaDescription: We look at what the UK government spends on the general public, such as pensions, provisions, and infrastructure.

title: Research and development expenditure
summary: Research and development in the UK carried out or funded by business enterprises, higher education, government (including research councils) and private non-profit organisations.
metaDescription: Research and development in the UK carried out or funded by business enterprises, higher education, government (including research councils) and private non-profit organisations.

title: Taxes and revenue
summary: The effect of taxes and benefits on UK household’s income.

title: Balance of payments
summary: All economic transactions between residents of the UK and the rest of the world.
metaDescription: All economic transactions between residents of the UK and the rest of the world.

title: Satellite accounts
summary: Accounts that cover activities linked to the economy but not part of the core UK national accounts including environmental accounts, tourism satellite account, and household satellite accounts.
metaDescription: Accounts that cover activities linked to the economy but not part of the core UK national accounts including environmental accounts, tourism satellite account, and household satellite accounts.

title: Supply and use tables
summary: Balances showing the relationship between components of value added, industry inputs and outputs, and product supply and demand. These tables are a source for the data underlying Gross Domestic Product.
metaDescription: Balances showing the relationship between components of value added, industry inputs and outputs, and product supply and demand. These tables are a source for the data underlying Gross Domestic Product.

title: UK sector accounts
summary: Transactions of particular groups of institutions (sectors) within the UK economy, showing how the income from production is distributed and redistributed and how savings are used to add wealth through investment in physical or financial assets.
metaDescription: Transactions of particular groups of institutions (sectors) within the UK economy, showing how the income from production is distributed and redistributed and how savings are used to add wealth through investment in physical or financial assets.

title: Gross disposable household income
summary: The amount of money that that all of the individuals in the household sector have available for spending or saving after income distribution measures (for example, taxes, social contributions and benefits) have taken effect. GDHI does not provide measures relating to actual households or family units. The figures cover regions, sub-regions and local areas of the UK.
metaDescription: The amount of money that that all of the individuals in the household sector have available for spending or saving after income distribution measures (for example, taxes, social contributions and benefits) have taken effect. GDHI does not provide measures relating to actual households or family units. The figures cover regions, sub-regions and local areas of the UK.

title: Earnings and working hours
summary: The level and growth rate of average weekly earnings (regular and bonus pay), and average weekly hours worked by full-time and part-time workers.
metaDescription: The level and growth rate of average weekly earnings (regular and bonus pay), and average weekly hours worked by full-time and part-time workers.

title: Employment and employee types
summary: Employment rates from the Labour Force Survey (LFS), broken down by age and sex. Employment rates show the number of people in employment as a proportion of the population. Other figures include the number of people in employment (also from the LFS) and vacancies (from the Vacancies Survey).
metaDescription: Employment rates from the Labour Force Survey (LFS), broken down by age. Other figures include men and women in employment (also from the LFS) and vacancies (from the Vacancies Survey). People in employment are classed as those working for pay or those working for no pay in a family business.

title: Labour productivity
summary: The efficiency of the UK workforce calculated as output per worker, output per job and output per hour. Labour productivity is an important factor in determining the productive potential of the economy. Countries with strong labour productivity growth tend to benefit from high rates of growth and low inflation.
metaDescription: The efficiency of the UK workforce calculated as output per worker, output per job and output per hour. Labour productivity is an important factor in determining the productive potential of the economy. Countries with strong labour productivity growth tend to benefit from high rates of growth and low inflation.

title: Public sector personnel
summary: People employed in central government, local government and public corporations, including those with a second job in the public sector. These statistics do not cover self-employed people, contract workers or agency workers.
metaDescription: People employed in central government, local government and public corporations, including those with a second job in the public sector. These statistics do not cover self-employed people, contract workers or agency workers.

title: Workplace disputes and working conditions
summary: Stoppages of work because of disputes between employers and employees. These include strikes and lock-outs (where an employer stops employees from entering a place of work). Figures include the number of days lost to workplace disputes in the public and private sectors and the number of workers involved.
metaDescription: Stoppages of work because of disputes between employers and employees. These include strikes (lawful and unlawful) and lock-outs (where an employer stops employees from entering a place of work). Figures include the number of days lost to workplace disputes in the public and private sectors and the number of workers involved.

title: Workplace pensions
summary: Individuals' pensions linked to their workplace, including defined ambition (DA), defined benefit (DB) and defined contribution (DC) schemes.
metaDescription: Individuals' pensions linked to their workplace, including defined ambition (DA), defined benefit (DB) and defined contribution (DC) schemes.

title: Economic inactivity
summary: People not in employment who have not been seeking work within the last 4 weeks and/or are unable to start work within the next 2 weeks.
metaDescription: People not in employment who have not been seeking work within the last 4 weeks and/or are unable to start work within the next 2 weeks.

title: Out of work benefits
summary: Claimants of unemployment related benefits including Employment and Support Allowance and other incapacity benefits, and Income Support and Pension Credit.
metaDescription: Claimants of unemployment related benefits including Employment and Support Allowance and other incapacity benefits, and Income Support and Pension Credit.

title: Redundancies
summary: People who have been made redundant or have taken voluntary redundancy.
metaDescription: People who have been made redundant or have taken voluntary redundancy.

title: Unemployment
summary: The level and rate of UK unemployment measured by the Labour Force Survey (LFS) using a definition of unemployment specified by the International Labour Organisation. Unemployed people as those without a job who have been actively seeking work in the past 4 weeks and are available to start work in the next 2 weeks. It also includes those who are out of work but have found a job and are waiting to start it in the next 2 weeks.
metaDescription: The level and rate of UK unemployment measured by the Labour Force Survey (LFS) using a definition of unemployment specified by the International Labour Organisation. Unemployed people as those without a job who have been actively seeking work in the past 4 weeks and are available to start work in the next 2 weeks. It also includes those who are out of work but have found a job and are waiting to start it in the next 2 weeks.

title: Adoption
summary: Adoption registrations including the age and gender of the children being adopted and whether they were born inside marriage.
metaDescription: Adoption registrations including the age and gender of the children being adopted and whether they were born inside marriage.

title: Ageing
summary: Population ageing and the lives of older people, including ageing indicators such as estimates of the very old (90+ by age and sex), median age and sex ratios at older ages at national and local levels.
metaDescription: Population ageing and the lives of older people, including ageing indicators such as estimates of the very old (90+ by age and sex), median age and sex ratios at older ages at national and local levels.

title: Conception and fertility rates
summary: Conceptions based on births and abortions data analysed by age and area; and childbearing of women born in different years, average family size and women who remain childless.
metaDescription: Conceptions based on births and abortions data analysed by age and area; and childbearing of women born in different years, average family size and women who remain childless.

title: Deaths
summary: Deaths broken down by age, sex, area and cause of death sourced from the deaths register.
metaDescription: Deaths broken down by age, sex, area and cause of death sourced from the deaths register.

title: Divorce
summary: Divorces taking place covering dissolutions and annulments of marriage by previous marital status, sex and age of persons divorcing, children of  divorced couples, fact proven at divorce and to whom granted.
metaDescription: Divorces taking place covering dissolutions and annulments of marriage by previous marital status, sex and age of persons divorcing, children of  divorced couples, fact proven at divorce and to whom granted.

title: Families
summary: The composition of families and households, including data on lone parents, married couples and civil partnership families. Household size and household types, including people living alone, multi-family households and households where members are all unrelated are also provided.
metaDescription: The composition of families and households, including data on lone parents, married couples and civil partnership families. Household size and household types, including people living alone, multi-family households and households where members are all unrelated are also provided.

title: Life expectancies
summary: How long, on average, people can expect to live using estimates of the population and the number of deaths.
metaDescription: How long, on average, people can expect to live using estimates of the population and the number of deaths.

title: Live births
summary: Live births by age of mother/father, sex, marital status, country of birth, socio-economic status, previous children and area.
metaDescription: Live births by age of mother/father, sex, marital status, country of birth, socio-economic status, previous children and area.

title: Marriage, cohabitation and civil partnerships
summary: Marriages formed, civil partnerships formed and dissolved, and estimates of the population by marital status and living arrangements.
metaDescription: Marriages formed, civil partnerships formed and dissolved, and estimates of the population by marital status and living arrangements.

title: Maternities
summary: Women having babies (including stillbirths). A maternity is a pregnancy resulting in the birth of 1 or more children, therefore, these figures are not the same as the number of babies born.
metaDescription: Women having babies (including stillbirths). A maternity is a pregnancy resulting in the birth of 1 or more children, therefore, these figures are not the same as the number of babies born.

title: Stillbirths
summary: Stillbirths containing data on cause of death and sex, plus analyses by some of the key risk factors affecting stillbirths, including age of mother and birthweight.
metaDescription: Stillbirths containing data on cause of death and sex, plus analyses by some of the key risk factors affecting stillbirths, including age of mother and birthweight.

title: Ethnicity
summary: Analyses include ethnic identities among the non-UK born population in England and Wales, labour market participation, trends in general health and unpaid care by ethnic group, and inter-ethnic relationships.
metaDescription: Analyses include ethnic identities among the non-UK born population in England and Wales, labour market participation, trends in general health and unpaid care by ethnic group, and inter-ethnic relationships.

title: Language
summary: The proportion of adults using English as their main language and a breakdown of other languages used in the UK.
metaDescription: The proportion of adults using English as their main language and a breakdown of other languages used in the UK.

title: Religion
summary: Analyses include people affiliating with a religion in the 2011 census, and religions among the non-UK born population in England and Wales.
metaDescription: Analyses include people affiliating with a religion in the 2011 census, and religions among the non-UK born population in England and Wales.

title: Sexuality
summary: Analyses include sexual identity in the UK by gender, region and age group, sourced from the Integrated Household Survey.
metaDescription: Analyses include sexual identity in the UK by gender, region and age group, sourced from the Integrated Household Survey.

title: Electoral registration
summary: Annual counts of people listed on electoral registers for the UK and its constituent countries, local government areas and parliamentary constituencies. These figures are based on people registered to vote not people eligible to vote.
metaDescription: Annual counts of people listed on electoral registers for the UK and its constituent countries, local government areas and parliamentary constituencies. These figures are based on people registered to vote not people eligible to vote.

title: General elections
summary: Forms of civic engagement, including satisfaction with government and democracy, interest in politics and participation in politics.
metaDescription: Forms of civic engagement, including satisfaction with government and democracy, interest in politics and participation in politics.

title: Local government elections
summary: Individuals’ engagement with local government, including involvement in decision-making.
metaDescription: Individuals’ engagement with local government, including involvement in decision-making.

title: Causes of death
summary: Annual mortality statistics on deaths registered by age group, sex and underlying cause of death, and by other information collected at the time of registration.

title: Child health
summary: Children's health and well-being including childhood, infant and perinatal mortality; unexplained deaths in infancy; childhood cancer survival; and children's well-being.

title: Conditions and diseases
summary: Health conditions and diseases including newly diagnosed cancers, deaths from MRSA and deaths involving clostridium difficile (bacterial infection).
metaDescription: Health conditions and diseases including newly diagnosed cancers, deaths from MRSA and deaths involving clostridium difficile (bacterial infection).

title: Disability
summary: People with disabilities and how disability affects day-to-day activities.
metaDescription: People with disabilities and how disability affects day-to-day activities.

title: Drug use, alcohol and smoking
summary: Smoking and drinking habits in Great Britain, deaths related to drug poisoning  and drug misuse, and deaths caused by diseases known to be related to alcohol consumption.
metaDescription: Smoking and drinking habits in Great Britain, deaths related to drug poisoning  and drug misuse, and deaths caused by diseases known to be related to alcohol consumption.

title: Health and life expectancies
summary: Comparisons and inequalities in healthy life expectancies (HLE), disability-free life expectancies (DFLE) and life expectancies (LE).
metaDescription: Comparisons and inequalities in healthy life expectancies (HLE), disability-free life expectancies (DFLE) and life expectancies (LE).

title: Health and well-being
summary: Analyses of social and economic data from government and other organisations to paint a picture of UK society and how it changes, including comparisons with other countries.
metaDescription: Analyses of social and economic data from government and other organisations to paint a picture of UK society and how it changes, including comparisons with other countries.

title: Health care system
summary: Expenditure on both private and public health care systems in the UK, as well as the results for the National Survey of Bereaved People (VOICES).
metaDescription: Expenditure on both private and public health care systems in the UK, as well as the results for the National Survey of Bereaved People (VOICES).

title: Health inequalities
summary: Current patterns and trends in ill health and death by measures of socio-economic status.
metaDescription: Current patterns and trends in ill health and death by measures of socio-economic status.

title: Mental health
summary: Mental health of children, adolescents and adults.
metaDescription: People who require social care, as well as those who work in social care, performance levels, and its financial cost.

title: Social care
summary: People who require social care, as well as those who work in social care, performance levels, and its financial cost.
metaDescription: People who require social care, as well as those who work in social care, performance levels, and its financial cost.

title: Home internet and social media usage
summary: Use of the internet and social media and how long we use it for. These data include the number of people who have used the internet, those who use the internet frequently and those who have never used the internet. Most of these statistics are broken down by age and gender.
metaDescription: Use of the internet and social media and how long we use it for. These data include the number of people who have used the internet, those who use the internet frequently and those who have never used the internet. Most of these statistics are broken down by age and gender.

title: Debt
summary: Debt of UK households, broken down by financial debt and property debt.
metaDescription: Debt of UK households, broken down by financial debt and property debt.

title: Expenditure
summary: Spending patterns of UK households, with findings taken from the Living Costs and Food Survey (LCF).
metaDescription: Spending patterns of UK households, with findings taken from the Living Costs and Food Survey (LCF).

title: Income and wealth
summary: UK household income and wealth.
metaDescription: UK households income and wealth.

title: Pensions, savings and investments
summary: State, private, occupational and workplace pensions, including pension trends that draws together data from other government departments and organisations.
metaDescription: State, private, occupational and workplace pensions, including pension trends that draws together data from other government departments and organisations.

title: International migration
summary: People moving into and out of the UK, long term migration, short term migration, and non-UK residents data providing a picture of those entering and leaving the UK, covering all lengths of stay.
metaDescription: People moving into and out of the UK, long term migration, short term migration, and visitor data providing a picture of those entering and leaving the UK, covering all lengths of stay.

title: Migration within the UK
summary: Residential moves between different geographic areas within the UK sourced from the NHS Patient Register, the NHS Central Register (NHSCR) and the Higher Education Statistics Agency (HESA).
metaDescription: Residential moves between different geographic areas within the UK sourced from the NHS Patient Register, the NHS Central Register (NHSCR) and the Higher Education Statistics Agency (HESA).

title: Population estimates
summary: Annual population estimates for the UK and its constituent countries, the regions and counties of England, and local authorities and their equivalents. Estimates for lower and middle layer Super Output Areas, Westminster parliamentary constituencies, electoral wards and National Parks in England and Wales and clinical commissioning groups in England.
metaDescription: Annual population estimates for the UK and its constituent countries, the regions and counties of England, and local authorities and their equivalents. Estimates for lower and middle layer Super Output Areas, Westminster parliamentary constituencies, electoral wards and National Parks in England and Wales and clinical commissioning groups in England.

title: Population projections
summary: Population projections provide an indication of the future size and age structure of the population based on mid-year population estimates and a set of assumptions of future fertility, mortality and migration. Available for the UK and its constituent countries as national population projections and for the regions, local authorities and clinical commissioning groups in England as subnational population projections. These projections are widely used for resource allocation and planning.
metaDescription: Population projections provide an indication of the future size and age structure of the population based on mid-year population estimates and a set of assumptions of future fertility, mortality and migration. Available for the UK and its constituent countries as national population projections and for the regions, local authorities and clinical commissioning groups in England as subnational population projections. These projections are widely used for resource allocation and planning.
